intro: Gossypium australe, commonly known as the Australian cotton plant, is a species native to Australia and belongs to the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, characterized by its woody stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers followed by capsules that contain fluffy, white seeds surrounded by a fibrous material. Gossypium australe is notable for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions, making it an important plant in ecological and agricultural contexts.
